goal.ch: “This is a graduate course for the Physics Institute. Nonlinear dynamics s is one of the current frontier fields in science, with immense applications in broad areas. The only way to learn it well is through lots of practicing, both by analysis and through numerical computations. Hard working is a must for this course. You will find that it is worth spending time on this fascinating subject. Emphasis will be on establishing the fundamental concepts and principles as well as training the necessary mathematical/computational tools for research in nonlinear physics. Students should expect to read the lecture notes, reference books and work hand on the homework problems regularly and carefully. Students are expected to present their ideas orally during the lectures. This course will be conducted in English, with possible explanations in Chinese when necessary.“
goal.en: “This is a graduate course for the Physics Institute. Nonlinear dynamics s is one of the current frontier fields in science, with immense applications in broad areas. The only way to learn it well is through lots of practicing, both by analysis and through numerical computations. Hard working is a must for this course. You will find that it is worth spending time on this fascinating subject. Emphasis will be on establishing the fundamental concepts and principles as well as training the necessary mathematical/computational tools for research in nonlinear physics. Students should expect to read the lecture notes, reference books and work hand on the homework problems regularly and carefully. Students are expected to present their ideas orally during the lectures. This course will be conducted in English, with possible explanations in Chinese when necessary.“

outline.ch:
0.Overview
1.Dynamical Systems, Ordinary differential Equations
2.Oscillations and Limit cycles
3.Bifurcations ＆ Stability analysis
4.Nonlinear maps
5.Deterministic Chaos, control of chaos
6.Nonlinear waves, Reaction-Diffusion Eq., Solitons
7.Pattern formation
outline.en:
0.Overview
1.Dynamical Systems, Ordinary differential Equations
2.Oscillations and Limit cycles
3.Bifurcations ＆ Stability analysis
4.Nonlinear maps
5.Deterministic Chaos, control of chaos
6.Nonlinear waves, Reaction-Diffusion Eq., Solitons
7.Pattern formation

textbook.ch:
“Lecture Notes will be provided.
Reference Books:  Nonlinear Dynamics and Chaos: With Applications to Physics, Biology, Chemistry, and Engineering, 2nd edition (2015), by S. Strogatz
                  Deterministic Chaos, 4th edition (2005), by H. G. Schuster and W. Just
Focus issue in Chaos: 25TH ANNIVERSARY OF CHAOS: PERSPECTIVES ON NONLINEAR SCIENCE—PAST, PRESENT, AND FUTURE  https://aip.scitation.org/toc/cha/25/9?expanded=25“

gradMethod.ch:

Midterm Exam: 35％
Final Exam: 35％“
